thread.title: Here's What's Happening - Clayton County Public Schools
thread.title_full: Here's What's Happening - Clayton County Public Schools

title: Here's What's Happening - Clayton County Public Schools
text:
Here's What's Happening
Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) honored its 2025 Employees of the Year at “The Legacy of Excellence” gala on September 13 at the Morrow Center. Nearly 700 guests celebrated school-level Teachers of the Year and district finalists during an evening of music, awards, and celebration!
“This celebration reflected the extraordinary dedication and talent of our educators and staff who inspire students every day,” said Dr. Anthony W. Smith, Superintendent/CEO of Schools. “Their commitment to excellence shapes the future of Clayton County Public Schools and ensures that we continue building a better tomorrow, today.”
This year’s top honorees include:
• Principal of the Year: Kimberlee Barnett – Jonesboro Middle
• District Teacher of the Year: Miranda Scott – Charles R. Drew High
• Support Leader (Certified): Dr. Sonja Bennings – Sequoyah Middle
• Support Professional (Certified): Natilia Hendrix – North Clayton High
• Support Leader (Classified): Jada Dawkins – Communications Division
• Support Professional (Classified): Gabysol Quiroz – Fountain Elementary
For full event details and photos, please see the attached advisory.
To view images of the 2025 Employee of the Year Gala, please click here.
To view the full-length 2025 Employee of the Year Gala, please click here.
